dt.t: {ldquo}Is that one the dressing room?{rdquo} asked Bean, pointing to the section with the dresser and the folding screen. {ldquo}{wi}Yeah{/wi}.{rdquo}
{ldquo}At first I was all, {lsquo}Me? A hero?{rsquo} And then I got to thinking about it and I realized that, {wi}yeah{/wi}, I am a hero …{rdquo}
{wi}Yeah{/wi}, it comes from classical music, but it comes from other places, too …
When the cowboy would say something like, {ldquo}Things are quiet around here tonight,{rdquo} she would join in with, {ldquo}{wi}Yeah{/wi}, too quiet,{rdquo} right on cue.

dt: often used sarcastically in phrases like {phrase}yeah, right{/phrase} and {phrase}yeah, sure{/phrase} to express doubt or disbelief

dt.t: {ldquo}I'm a really big fan,{rdquo} gushed [Al Gore]. {ldquo}{wi}Yeah, right{/wi},{rdquo} sneered Miss Love.
… she claims technologies like peer-to-peer file swapping are about to put record companies out of business. {wi}Yeah, right{/wi}.
A {ldquo}{wi}Yeah, sure{/wi},{rdquo} reaction from many in the archaeological community to gaudy claims about Warm Mineral Springs was not surprising.

shortdef: yes —often used sarcastically in phrases like yeah, right and yeah, sure to express doubt or disbelief

dt: used in speech to show surprise, doubt, or interest

dt.t: "I'm from Maine." "{it}Oh yeah{/it}? I didn't know that."

shortdef: —used in speech to show surprise, doubt, or interest
